workflow.name: Monitor ad performance drops with Meta & Google Ads + multi-channel alerts
workflow.description:
## How it works
This workflow monitors Meta Ads and Google Ads campaigns on a daily schedule to detect performance drops. It fetches yesterday‚Äôs campaign data, standardizes metrics, and calculates CTR and ROAS against fixed benchmarks. Campaigns that fall below thresholds are flagged automatically. Alerts are then sent across multiple channels and all results are logged in Google Sheets for tracking.

## Step-by-step
- **Step 1: Fetch ad performance data**
  - **Schedule Trigger (Daily Ad Check2)** ‚Äì Runs the Meta Ads performance check at the scheduled time.
  - **HTTP Request (Fetch Meta Ads Data)** ‚Äì Retrieves campaign metrics from the Meta Ads API.
  - **Set (Set Benchmarks)** ‚Äì Normalizes Meta Ads data and assigns platform details.
  - **Schedule Trigger (Daily Ad Check3)** ‚Äì Runs the Google Ads performance check at a separate scheduled time.
  - **Google Ads (Get many campaigns)** ‚Äì Fetches campaign performance data from Google Ads.
  - **Set (Set Benchmarks4)** ‚Äì Normalizes Google Ads data and assigns platform details.

- **Step 2: Detect performance drops**
  - **Code (Detect Performance Drop)** ‚Äì Calculates CTR and ROAS, compares them with predefined benchmarks, and flags drops.
  - **If** ‚Äì Filters only campaigns where a performance drop is detected.
  - **Split In Batches (Loop Over Items)** ‚Äì Processes each affected campaign individually.

- **Step 3: Alert and log results**
  - **WhatsApp (Send message1)** ‚Äì Sends instant WhatsApp alerts for critical visibility.
  - **Slack (Send a message)** ‚Äì Posts detailed alerts to a Slack channel.
  - **Gmail (Send a message4)** ‚Äì Sends email notifications with full campaign metrics.
  - **Code (Code in JavaScript)** ‚Äì Recombines campaign data after notifications.
  - **Wait (Wait1)** ‚Äì Ensures alert delivery before logging.
  - **Google Sheets (your-google-sheets-name)** ‚Äì Appends or updates campaign records for reporting and audit history.

## Why use this?
- Catch CTR and ROAS drops before ad spend is wasted.
- Monitor Meta Ads and Google Ads in a single automated flow.
- Notify teams instantly via WhatsApp, Slack, and Email.
- Keep a centralized performance log for analysis and reporting.
- Reduce manual checks with consistent daily monitoring.

workflow.name: Automate ad performance monitoring with Meta Ads, Google Ads & Email alerts

parameters.text: =Hello, This is an automated performance alert from your ad monitoring system. One of your ad campaigns has shown a significant performance drop based on today‚Äôs analysis. Please review the details below: Campaign Name: {{ $json.campaign_name }} Platform: {{ $json.platform || "Meta Ads" }} Performance Metrics: ‚Ä¢ Impressions: {{ $json.impressions }} ‚Ä¢ Clicks: {{ $json.clicks }} ‚Ä¢ Spend: {{ $json.spend }} ‚Ä¢ CTR: {{ $json.ctr }}% ‚Ä¢ ROAS: {{ $json.roas }} Status: {{ $json.Performance_Status }} Reason: {{ $json.Drop_Reason }} We recommend reviewing targeting, creatives, bidding strategy, or budget allocation to prevent further performance loss. This alert was generated automatically to help you take timely action and reduce wasted ad spend. If you need assistance analyzing or optimizing this campaign, feel free to reach out. Best regards, Ad Performance Monitoring Bot Automated via n8n

parameters.subject: üö® Ad Performance Alert: Immediate Attention Required

parameters.content:
## Ad Performance Drop Alert Automation (Google & Meta Ads)

This workflow monitors your Google Ads and Meta Ads campaigns on a daily schedule to detect sudden performance drops and notify your team immediately. It helps prevent wasted ad spend by catching issues early, before they impact results at scale.

### How it works
The workflow runs automatically using scheduled triggers. It pulls yesterday‚Äôs campaign performance data from Meta Ads and Google Ads, including impressions, clicks, spend, and conversion values. For each campaign, it calculates key metrics such as CTR, revenue, and ROAS. These values are compared against predefined benchmarks to identify campaigns that are underperforming. When a drop is detected, the campaign is flagged with a clear performance status and drop reason. Alerts are then sent through multiple channels, and the event is logged for tracking and reporting.

### Setup steps
1. Connect your Meta Ads account and provide a valid access token.
2. Authenticate your Google Ads account.
3. Review and adjust CTR and ROAS thresholds in the performance detection logic.
4. Connect Slack, Gmail, and WhatsApp for alerts.
5. Link a Google Sheet to store alert history.
6. Set your preferred daily schedule times.
7. Activate the workflow.

## Step 1: Fetch Ad Performance Data
Pulls daily campaign metrics from Meta Ads and Google Ads using scheduled triggers.

## Step 2: Detect Performance Drops
Calculates CTR and ROAS and flags campaigns that fall below defined benchmarks.

## Step 3: Alert & Log Results
Sends alerts via Slack, Email, and WhatsApp and logs results in Google Sheets.

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.
